meanings.definition: A standardized piece of text or code used repeatedly in various documents or projects.
meanings.sent1: I always keep a folder of boilerplates for quick reference when writing emails.
meanings.sent2: The company uses boilerplates to ensure consistency in their legal documents.
meanings.sent3: When the teacher asked for our essays, I jokingly said I wish I had a magic boilerplate to fill them out instantly.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was like a well-crafted boilerplate, hitting all the key points effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The boilerplate for the email signature made it easy for everyone to have a professional look.

meanings.definition: A metal plate used to cover the opening of a boiler.
meanings.sent1: The maintenance worker carefully removed the old boilerplate to inspect the boiler.
meanings.sent2: The shiny boilerplate gleamed in the sunlight, protecting the boiler from dust.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to play with the boilerplate, thinking it was a shiny toy.
meanings.sent4: The boilerplate sat atop the boiler like a guardian, shielding it from harm.
meanings.sent5: The boilerplate clanged loudly as it was placed back on the boiler, securing it in place.
